Labor Union1: COMMUNITY AND SOCIAL AGENCY EMPLOYEES UNION, DISTRICT COUNCIL 1707, AFSCME, AFL-CIO
Union to Certify: COMMUNITY AND SOCIAL AGENCY EMPLOYEES UNION, DISTRICT COUNCIL 1707, AFSCME, AFL-CIO
Voting Unit (Unit A):
UNIT A  (Professional Unit)

INCLUDED:	All full-time and regular part-time teachers employed by Marc Academy And Family Center, Inc.,
at 2105-2111 Jerome Avenue, Bronx, NY, during the payroll period ending Friday, January 16, 2009.
 
EXCLUDED:	All non-professional employees set forth in Unit B, below, and all other employees, including confidential employees, and guards and supervisors as defined in the Act.

UNIT B   (Non-Professional Unit)

INCLUDED:	  All full-time and regular part-time assistant teachers, teacher aides, administrative assistants,
cooks, assistant cooks, and custodians employed by Marc Academy And Family Center, Inc., at 2105-2111
Jerome Avenue, Bronx, NY, during the payroll period ending Friday, January 16, 2009.
 		
EXCLUDED:	  All professional employees as set forth in Unit A, above, and all other employees, including confidential employees, and guards and supervisors as defined in the Act.

The employees in the professional voting group A shall be furnished a ballot containing the following questions:

	Do you desire to be included in the same unit as non-professional
employees for the purposes of collective bargaining? ("Yes" or "No")

	Do you desire to be represented for the purposes of collective 
bargaining by Community and Social Agency Employees' Union, District Council 1707,  
AFSCME, AFL-CIO? ("Yes" or "No")

If a majority of the employees in Voting Group A vote "yes" to the first question, indicating a choice to be included in the overall unit with the non-professional employees, the professional employees will be so included.  The ballots of the professional employees will then be counted with the ballots of the non-professional voting group to decide the representative of the entire unit.  If, however, a majority of the professional employees in Voting Group A do not vote for inclusion, these employees will not be included in the non-professional employee unit and their votes on the second question will be separately counted to decide whether they want to be represented in a professional unit.

employees for the purposes of collective bargaining? ("Yes" or "No")

	Do you desire to be represented for the purposes of collective 
bargaining by Community and Social Agency Employees' Union, District Council 1707,  
AFSCME, AFL-CIO? ("Yes" or "No")

If a majority of the employees in Voting Group A vote "yes" to the first question, indicating a choice to be included in the overall unit with the non-professional employees, the professional employees will be so included.  The ballots of the professional employees will then be counted with the ballots of the non-professional voting group to decide the representative of the entire unit.  If, however, a majority of the professional employees in Voting Group A do not vote for inclusion, these employees will not be included in the non-professional employee unit and their votes on the second question will be separately counted to decide whether they want to be represented in a professional unit.

Labor Union1: COMMUNITY AND SOCIAL AGENCY EMPLOYEES' UNION, DISTRICT COUNCIL 1707, AFSCME
Union to Certify: COMMUNITY AND SOCIAL AGENCY EMPLOYEES' UNION, DISTRICT COUNCIL 1707, AFSCME
Voting Unit (Unit A):
INCLUDED:	  All full-time and regular part-time teachers employed by La Peninsula Community 
Organization, Inc., at its facility located at 1423 Prospect Avenue, Bronx, NY.

EXCLUDED:	  All non-professional employees set forth in Unit B, below, and all other employees, 
including confidential employees, and guards and supervisors as defined in the Act.

UNIT B (Non-Professional Unit)

INCLUDED:	  All full-time and regular part-time assistant teachers, family workers, janitors, cooks, and 
secretaries employed by La Peninsula Community Organization, Inc., at its facility located at 1423 Prospect 
Avenue, Bronx, NY.

EXCLUDED:	  All professional employees as set forth in Unit A, above, and all other employees, 
including confidential employees, and guards and supervisors as defined in the Act.

The employees in the professional voting group A shall be furnished a ballot containing the following questions:

	Do you desire to be included in the same unit as non-professional employees for the purposes of collective
bargaining? ("Yes" or "No")

	Do you desire to be represented for the purposes of collective bargaining by Community and Social Agency 
Employees' Union, District Council 1707,  AFSCME, AFL-CIO? ("Yes" or "No")

If a majority of the employees in Voting Group A vote "yes" to the first question, indicating a choice to be included in the overall unit with the non-professional employees, the professional employees will be so included.  The ballots of the professional employees will then be counted with the ballots of the non-professional voting group to decide the representative of the entire unit.  If, however, a majority of the professional employees in Voting Group A do not vote for inclusion, these employees will not be included in the non-professional employee unit and their votes on the second question will be separately counted to decide whether they want to be represented in a professional unit.

Voting Unit (Unit A):

* In accord with the board's holdings in Daniel Construction Company, Inc., 133 NLRB 264 (1961)) as modified at 167 NLRB 1078 (1967), and Steiny and Company, Inc., 308 NLRB 1323 (1992), in addition to those employees eligible to vote under the standard criteria, unit employees are elilgible to vote if they have been employed in the unit for either (1) a total of 30 days or more within the 12 months preceding the payroll period for eligibility or, within the 12 months preceding the payroll period for eligibility  or, (2) if they have had some employment in those 12 months and have been employed for a total of 45 days or more within the 24-month period immediately preceding the payroll period for eligibility, and who have not quit or been discharged for cause prior to the payroll period for eligibility.
